User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

Display a menu item, either by clicking or keyboard.

To recreate the problem most effectively, type Alt-F and then hold down the right-arrow key to start the menu's displaying sequentially. Problem occurs within a few seconds typically. Occasionally occurs during normal use just by mouse clicking on an item in the menu bar or folder on the bookmarks toolbar.

It does NOT occur in safe-mode (Help | Restart with add-ons disabled).
Problem DOES occur however even after checking all options to reset all user settings to defaults (but did not try deleting all bookmarks).


Actual results:

Entire menu drop-down displayed as black rectangle or black rectangle with tan-colored pattern.


Expected results:

Menu displayed as black text on white background.
comments.creator: bobs00@cox.net

Yes, still having this issue, and it is reproducible when running with a clean profile.

I also found that the problem does not occur when I change my video card settings to enable an HDTV as a clone of my monitor. Disabling the HDTV output resumes the FireFox problem.

While this certainly does sound like a bug in the video driver, it is strange that the only application that I have any display issues with is FireFox, and only when it's not running in safe-mode.

FYI, I'm using an ATI Radeon HD 4650 video card and running the Catalyst version 10.12 driver (not the latest, but I had other unrelated issues with the latest that forced me to roll back to 10.12).
